Reviews.Title: “very good and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: donald r
Reviews.Content: Ist not the first time that we book this hotel (9 th) in a quiet street and very nice breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/service/location”
Reviews.Author: travelguy9663
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, room rate includes breakfast every morning. Hotel located just a few blocks from U-bahn station ..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Austriacus
Reviews.Content: My stay at Arco Hotel started with a pleasant surprise since the director, Mr. Osterloh, gave me a double room for the price of the single room booked. I appreciated this nice gesture because the room was not only spacious but also at the end of the corridor. So I enjoyed perfect silence during the night. This room was directed to the inner court full of trees and may be one of the very few hotel rooms in the centre of Berlin where traffic is virtually inaudible. In order not to raise too high expectations I must admit that the house itself is not fully sound-proof. Actually, quite some noise results if somebody flushes the toilet or walks around in the room above. Thus, the silence I experienced was due to a large extent also to the considerate behaviour of the other guests. My room was modern, in best condition and spotless. It was definitely of much higher standard than one would expect in such a moderately priced hotel. The room was equipped with a king-size double bed and a flat screen TV with 16 channels, including BBC and CNN. I would have preferred the mattress and pillow of the bed to be firmer, but this is an issue of personal preferences. Apart from that, my only minor criticism regards the illumination of the desk, which is not really appropriate for reading. Of course, the breakfast buffet of this small hotel cannot compete with that of hotels of hundreds of rooms. However, I did not miss anything and was even offered freshly boiled eggs. On top of all that, Arco Hotel is situated in a nice and calm residential area garnished with some decent restaurants. I may have had particular luck, which cannot be taken for granted. At any rate, I enjoyed a perfect stay and exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel located in a quiet and convenient area”
Reviews.Author: Thebestinparis
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel for friends or couples who wish to visit Berlin. The rooms are spacious, well maintained, with high ceilings. Breakfast can be taken outside on the terrace surrounded by a lovely garden when the weather permits it. The only downside would be the fact that Internet is really slow. The hotel is also well located, not far from the KaDeWe and close to the subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: cdnguyOttawa
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Arco for 5 nights in early September while we were on vacation. We are not interested in many of the services luxury hotels offer - just a clean, quiet room, a decent breakfast, and approachable staff. The Arco more than met our requirements: a beautiful, well maintained room, excellent breakfasts, and friendly staff who happily responded to any questions we had. The hotel is in a very nice, quiet area of treed streets, and there is an U-Bahn station only a few minutes walk away (Viktoria-Luise-Platz), with trains to Nollendorfplatz every 10 minutes even on Sunday morning, and usually much more frequently. The Ku-Damm, the Kaiser-Wilhelm-Gedächtniskirche, Wittenbergplatz, and KaDeWe are all within about 10 minutes walk. We used the U- and S-Bahn to travel all over Berlin and found the Arco to be an excellent base and a nice, quiet, comfortable place to come back to. We will definitely stay at the Arco when we return to Berlin and can recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic budget accomodation in a wonderful residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JimBeau-n-TX
Reviews.Content: Was delighted by the Hotel Arco. I was amazed at how large my room and bath were for the price. The hotel is located on a peaceful, tree-lined street, yet is close to all sorts of nightlife for those who want to partake. The Viktoria-Luise-Platz U-Bahn station is just a short (and pleasant) walk away, which will quickly connect you to other transit routes throughout the city. This old, restored building has a lot of charm, including a courtyard and a beautiful staircase and entrance. The German breakfast was delicious and there was plenty to tide you over until a late lunch or early dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: garbochicago
Reviews.Content: Three friends stayed four nights at the lovely Arco Hotel and found it a wonderful value. It's not a fancy place but just what we were looking for - very clean, comfortable and friendly. Our triple room was perfect for us and overlooked the garden, where we breakfasted each morning. The bathroom was spotless and modern and included hairdyer, soap, shampoo, etc. The location was ideal - a lovely neighborhood, with beautiful gardens and many restaurants and bars nearby (as well as two grocery stores). The hotel is a short walk to Ku'Damm and the KaDeWe. Rolf was a wonderful host. He gave us terrific advice for dining and getting around the city (the reception sell passes for public transportation). Rolf also kindly arranged for a cab to drive us to the airport to catch our very early morning flight. I recommend Hotel Arco for people who are looking for a good value for a clean, comfortable place to rest after site-seeing in beautiful Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location - very worthy”
Reviews.Author: JYL072
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with our 4 year daughter in this hotel and were very happy for our selection. Price included breakfast (our search criteria) and we enjoyed it on a nice breakfast room or on the terrace. Location is also very good: Quiet area but just a walk from Zoo and marketstreet where for example big department store KaDeWe is located. Our room was nice and there was much space for us and an extra bed for our daughter. Only things missing was air-conditioning and refridgerator. Definately recommended place if you are not seeking luxury.

Reviews.Title: “great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: jdwalker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Arco for four nights on our first trip to Berlin. We booked the Arco in advance by email, and got a rate of 79 Euro per night, which we thought was quite a good deal. As others have noted, the Arco is slightly worn around the edges but has compensating virtues. The location is very good, quite near the Ku'damm and Gedächtniskirche, and yet the street is quiet and the neighborhood homey. Our room was not elegant but had very high ceilings and opened onto the courtyard -- of all the places we stayed in Germany, the Arco was the quietest. Friendly, helpful staff; cheap internet connection; good bikes available for rent. We'd stay in the Arco again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TCARBONNEL
Reviews.Content: We spent almost one week in Arco Hotel. We enjoy the hotel : - room are clean and simple - silent - good breakfast - helpfull and simpathatic staff The location is very convenient, very close to the U2 metro line. It is easy to visit Berlin from the hotel with the public transportation. I can definitively recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel /good location”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGCanada
Reviews.Content: Good , small hotel. Helpful staff. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lies, lies”
Reviews.Author: patinthebush
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at this hotel from 20-22 of Feb. I had to cancel a couple of days beforehand & was told I would have to pay 80% of the cost if the room remained empty. I rang the hotel on the 21st & asked if a room was available & was told the hotel was full. I was still charged the 80% rate. I feel this practise is very dishonest

Reviews.Title: “Good Gay-Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brass612
Reviews.Content: Good location near the gay area in Berlin. Easy walking distance to the restaurants, bars and shops in the neighborhood. Very quiet setting overlooking a courtyard. Good, friendly staff and come-and-go as you wish attitude. Okay breakfast, nothing special. All around decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Worn Around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: aussiepiper
Reviews.Content: They say that first impressions count, in which case the worn and dirty polypropylene carpet in the lobby could do well to be replaced. Based on the generally excellent reviews on this web site, we booked our stay directly with the hotel and found their reservations side of things very prompt and efficient. The hotel seems to be part hotel and part permanent accomodation. The lady in the room next to ours had a dog and gave the impression that she was a permanent resident. In any event, the staff were polite and efficient and breakfast excellent. It was good to have muesli on offer with yoghurt and a cooked egg offered as well. Newspapers in English were provided. As other reviewers have pointed out the breakfast room is nicely presented and opens onto a central garden area. The room itself was between two and three star, pretty tired really and the bathroom about 800mm wide, yes, pretty cosy. Our house maid ignored the "do not disturb" sign every day, which given the night life on offer in Berlin was quite irritating. Also, it would appear that her vacuum cleaner was all noise and no suck, because the carpet in our room appeared not to have been vacuumed for some time, yet the sound of machine could well and truly be heard. The owner of the hotel is a particularly pleasant and polite chap who seemed happy to help on any matter. The last word though must be on price. This is probably good value for money, so taking into account all of my comments above, I wouldn't rule it out on the basis that it offers location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Berlin--Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Train4Babs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arco five nights late April – early May. I agree with all the other reviews. I had a single from for 75 Euros a night. A very good value for Berlin. The hotel is connected to an apartment building which gives it a very residential feel. I had room 403 which was on the top floor and for the most part, very quiet. I didn’t hear the sound of people taking showers in other rooms which is common in most hotels. There was a dog barking very loudly off and on during the first night (which I also hear all the time back home, so I’m used to it), but other than that, I was both surprised and pleased that the hotel was so quiet. As typically in many hotels in Europe that have been renovated, the elevator stops half-way between floors, which means you have to drag your bags up half a flight. Then there is an old door that you have to unlock to get access to the hallway. It looked like something out of "Cabaret"! I wasn’t crazy about the bathroom, yes it was modern, but it was one of those typically every small European types. You might want to bring your own wash rag as they do not provide them. I also loved the location. It’s nice to stay in a residential area that with easy access to U-Bahn, KaDeWe and the gay area of Nollendorfplatz. Felt very safe walking alone at night. Front desk staff was friendly, however, they don’t tend to stay by the desk (they don’t need to as you are given your own key). One minor complaint: all the guide books I read recommend getting the “WelcomeCard” which provides 72 free hours on public transportation in Berlin and Brandenburg, as well as reduced or free admission on sightseeing tours, museums and a discount for my favorite, the “Berlin Walks” tours. When I asked to purchase the Welcome Card at the front desk, they sold me a “City Tour Card” instead. This card offered similar discounts, plus 72 hours of free public transportation in zones A & B, however, the Welcome Card also includes transit in Zone C which covers Potsdam. I didn’t find the difference between the two cards after I purchased it. Otherwise, I would defiantly stay at the Arco again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a superb Hotel very clean rooms and tastefully furnished The Staff are very helpful and friendly The Hotel is well located in near the Ku-damn and very near to the U bahn . Breakfast offered is of a high standard in a pleasant airy room with the option of eating al fresco in a small garden I have stayed here several times and will continue to patronise in the future . The Hotel is very good value and ideal for a 1st time visitor to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable place near Ku'Damm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Arco is located just five minutes from Ku'Damm, in a quiet resedential area. The breakfast room is lovely and well-appointed, the rooms spacious and clean. The front desk is staffed until midnight and offers excellent prices on coffee, tea and alcohol. The location makes you feel more like a resident than a tourist. Be sure to visit the Vietnemese restaraunt one block west (the name escapes me, but it's between an Apotheken and a Kneiper).

Reviews.Title: “Been several times, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MGandAK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a few times at this hotel, and have always been very satisfied. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well-equipped for the price. The hotel is quiet and in an ideal location for nightlife, shopping, transport links etc. The staff are very helpful and cheerful without being intrusive, and the breakfast is substantial and varied. Don't book for Easter, though. That is when I normally stay and I don't want competition for bookings!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice Place for the money.Was here in October 1999.The rooms were clean and quiet.Nice sound proofing.Bathrooms were modern and clean.Great location close to KaDaWE department store and other attractions.Nice Breakfast in the morning.Would definetly stay here again.
